meanings.definition: A military garrison or fortified place
meanings.sent1: The presidia was heavily guarded to protect the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The ancient city had multiple presidia to defend against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The presidia threw a surprise party for the soldiers, pretending it was a drill.
meanings.sent4: The presidia stood tall like mighty fortresses, ready to repel any invaders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the presidia overlooking the valley was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things acting as a defense or protection
meanings.sent1: The presidia of loyal knights surrounded the king at all times.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood watch formed a presidia to keep the streets safe.
meanings.sent3: The presidia of scarecrows in the field made the birds think twice before landing.
meanings.sent4: Her friends were like a presidia, shielding her from bullies at school.
meanings.sent5: The presidia of bodyguards moved in unison to protect the VIP.

meanings.definition: The plural form of presidium, a governing body or council
meanings.sent1: The presidia met to discuss new laws and regulations for the city.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, presidia have the power to veto decisions made by the ruler.
meanings.sent3: The presidia had a heated debate over the best way to allocate resources.
meanings.sent4: The presidia worked together like a well-oiled machine, ensuring the city ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Members of the presidia wore matching robes to signify their unity.
